Tonga: Tuʻihalafatai renounced power and moved to Fiji.
Taiwan: Jiayi and Zhanghua prefectures go to war over gambling debts and more than 400 villages are destroyed
Sweden: Sweden purchases the Caribbean island of Saint Barthélemy from France.
Ireland: After agitation by the Irish Volunteers, the Parliament of Great Britain passed a number of reforms - including the repeal of Poynings' Law - collectively referred to as the Constitution of 1782.
Colombia: Juan de Torrezar Díaz Pimienta is Viceroy of New Granada
Antonio Caballero y Góngora is Viceroy of New Granada
Belgium: Council of Luxembourg becomes a "sovereign" court: its legal decisions can no longer be appealed to the Great Council of Mechelen.
